lines.content: /** Class field by that tells when the deadline is due. */

* The Duke class represents a simple task management chatbot application.
* It allows users to interact with a list of tasks and store them in a file.
* Constructs a Duke instance with the specified file path.
* @param filepath The path to the file used for storing tasks.
* Runs the Duke application, allowing users to interact with tasks.
* This method displays a welcome message, creates a data directory if it doesn't exist,
* loads tasks from the storage, and repeatedly prompts the user for input until "bye" is entered.
// Creates data folder if doesn't exist
System.out.println("        Failed to create data directory.");
// Exit the loop if the user types "bye"
* The main method to start the Duke application.
* Creates an instance of Duke with the data file path and runs the application.
/** Class field by that tells when the event is from. */
/** Class field by that tells until when the event is done. */
* Constructor to initialize the Events class.
* @param from When the event is from.
* @param to Until when the event is to.
public Events(String description, String from,  String to) {
return String.format("E | %s | %s | %s | %s", doneStatus, this.description, this.from, this.to);
return String.format("[E][%s] %s (from: %s to: %s)", this.getStatusIcon(), this.description, this.from, this.to);
* The Parser class is responsible for parsing user input and file input
* to create and manipulate tasks in the Duke application.
* Parses user input and performs corresponding actions on the task list.
* @param taskList  The list of tasks to be manipulated.
public static void parseUserInput(String userInput, TaskList taskList) {

Ui.showError("The description of a todo cannot be empty");

// Makes sure deadline format is followed (e.g. there's /by)
// If description or by is empty
Ui.showError("The description or by of a deadline cannot be empty");
// If user wants to create an Events task
// Makes sure deadline format is followed (e.g. there's /from and /to)
// If description, from, or to is empty
Ui.showError("The description or from or to of an event cannot be empty");
// If user wants to delete a task
// IF user wants to find a task
Ui.showError("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means");
* Parses a string representation of a task and creates a Task object.
* This method takes a string representation of a task in a specific format
* and parses it to create a corresponding Task object. The input string is
* split using the "|" delimiter and the task type, status, description, and
* other relevant information are extracted to create the appropriate task.
* The created task object is then returned.
* @param line The string representation of a task to be parsed.
* @return A Task object created from the parsed string representation.
LocalDate deadlineDate = LocalDate.parse(by, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy"));
* The Storage class is responsible for loading and saving tasks to a file in the Duke application.
* It provides methods to read tasks from a file and write tasks to a file.
* Constructs a Storage instance with the specified file path.
* @param filepath The path to the file used for storing tasks.
* Loads tasks from a file and populates the provided list with the loaded tasks.
* This method reads tasks from a file specified by the DATA_FILE_PATH and adds them to
* the provided list of tasks. If the file does not exist, it will be created.
* @param list The list to which loaded tasks will be added.
// Create a File object representing the data file

// Use a Scanner to read tasks from the file
// Read each line from the file
// Convert the line to a Task object using Task.fromString
// Add the task to the provided list if it's not null
// Handle IO exception by printing an error message
Ui.showError("An error occurred while loading tasks");
* Saves tasks from a list to a file.
* This method writes tasks from the provided list to a file specified by the DATA_FILE_PATH.
* The tasks are converted to their file representation using the toFileString method of
* the Task class. If an error occurs during the file writing process, an error message
* @param list The list of tasks to be saved to the file.
// Create a File object representing the data file
// Create a FileWriter to write tasks to the file
// Write each task's file representation to the file
// Handle IO exception by printing an error message
Ui.showError("An error occurred while saving tasks");
* The Task class represents a task in the Duke application.
* It contains fields and methods to manage task descriptions, completion status,
* and generating formatted string representations for display and storage.
/** Class field description that describes the task. */
/** Class field isDone that tells whether the task is marked. */
* Constructor to initialize the Task class.
* Gets the description of the task.
* Method to get the status icon of the task.
* @return String "X" if task's isDone is true, " " otherwise.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Checks if the task is done.
* @return `true` if the task is done, otherwise `false`.
* Method that sets the task's isDone to true.
* Method that sets the task's isDone to false.
* Generates a string representation of the task for file storage.
* @return A formatted string representation of the task for file storage.
* The TaskList class represents a list of tasks in the Duke application.
* It provides methods to manipulate and interact with the list of tasks.
* Constructs a TaskList instance with the provided list of tasks.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to be managed by the TaskList.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param task The task to be added to the list.
* Marks a task as done in the task list.
* @param task The task to be marked as done.
* Marks a task as not done in the task list.
* @param task The task to be marked as not done.
* Deletes a task from the task list.
* @param task The task to be deleted from the list.
* Finds and displays tasks that contain the specified keyword in their description.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* Returns the number of tasks in the task list.
* @return The number of tasks in the list.
* Returns the task at the specified index in the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Constructor to initialize the ToDos class.
* The Ui class handles user interface interactions in the Duke application.
* It provides methods to display messages, errors, and task-related information
* to the user using the console.
/** Constant divider used for separating UI sections. */
* Displays a divider line in the console.
* Displays a welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("        What can I do for you?");
* Displays an error message to the user.
* @param error The error message to be displayed.
* Displays a message indicating a task has been marked as done.
* @param task The task that has been marked as done.
System.out.println("        Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays a message indicating a task has been marked as not done.
* @param task The task that has been marked as not done.
System.out.println("         OK! I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays a message indicating a task has been added to the task list.
* @param task     The task that has been added.
public static void showAddedTask(Task task, TaskList taskList) {
System.out.println("        Got it! I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("        Now you have " + taskList.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a message indicating a task has been deleted from the task list.
* @param task     The task that has been deleted.
public static void showDeletedTask(Task task, TaskList taskList) {
System.out.println("        Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println("        Now you have " + taskList.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays the list of tasks to the user.
* @param taskList The task list to be displayed.
System.out.println("        Sure! Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays a list of tasks that match the search criteria.
* @param matchingTasks The list of tasks that match the search criteria.
System.out.println("        Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Displays a farewell message to the user.
System.out.println("        Bye ~ Hope to see you again soon ~");
* The ParserTest class contains test cases for the Parser class in the Duke application.
* It verifies the correctness of the parseFileInput method using JUnit tests.
* Tests the parsing of a "todos" task representation from a file input string.
* The TaskTest class contains test cases for the Task class in the Duke application.
* It verifies the correctness of the toFileString method using JUnit tests.
* Tests the conversion of a task to its file representation string.
